p: C. grandiflora Small (large-flowered rosemary) is endemic to the scrub habitat of Floridaâ€™s east coast between Daytona Beach and Miami as well as near Orlando and Okeechobee County [ 5]. A regime of frequent fires benefits C. grandiflora because it cannot tolerate shade and requires an open sunny habitat. C. grandiflora is a candidate for listing as an endangered species but of a lower priority than other Conradina species [ 5]. Loss of the Florida scrub habitat is the major threat to this species.
